page.title: 04TIMBER OPERATIONS.
page.content: Trees only have a 6-8wk. growing season per year.Good,heavy hardwoods, like{Elm}and{Oak,}take over 130yrs.to grow to only 35cm.in diameter.They are worth ten times more than softwoods ({Spruce}and{Larch})which are cut after 30yrs.Oak is worth about Â£6 per cubic meter. Hardwood is sent to a large,Midland timber firm who make{VENEER}by turning whole trunks and "peeling" off each growth ring.They also make timbers for special building projects like beams to re-roof{YORK MINSTER.}Much hardwood is exported to{FRANCE}where it is made into quality wood furniture. In{KENNYTHORPE,}a woodyard also makes farm fencing and pit-props for mines.Stacked timber is all around the yard,seasoning,or waiting to be trimmed ready for shipment.There are over{300 acres}of woods in this area.
